keyword: how many calories in a salt
title: How Many Calories in a Salt?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a salt (zero, as expected), plus sodium details, nutrition breakdown per gram, and common FAQs for dietary tracking.
h1: How Many Calories in a Salt?
assumptions: Table salt (sodium chloride), fine grain; 1 g as a standard small serving (about 1/5 tsp).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type (table, sea, kosher) and grain size; salt is calorie-free but high in sodium. Consult labels for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A gram of salt contains 0 calories but about 390 mg sodium.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use sea salt instead of table salt
Kosher salt (flakier, less dense per volume)

faqs.q: How many calories in a salt serving?
faqs.a: Zero calories in 1 g of salt or any amount—salt provides no energy.

faqs.q: What's the sodium in a salt?
faqs.a: About 390 mg sodium per 1 g of table salt.

faqs.q: Does salt have any macros like carbs or protein?
faqs.a: No—salt has 0 g carbs, protein, fat, or fiber.

faqs.q: How much salt is too much daily?
faqs.a: Aim for under 2,300 mg sodium (about 6 g salt) per day; consult health guidelines.

faqs.q: Are there calories in different types of salt?
faqs.a: No, all pure salts (table, sea, Himalayan) have 0 calories.
